article.title: Requirements gathering and analysis phase
article.label: Inception Phase
article.intro: Learn about the Inception Phase, dedicated to requirements gathering
article.description: Inception Phase starts project, defines Schedule, Risks and Scope (by means of specifications). Inception Phase finishes with LCO milestone.
article.keywords: inception phase, LCO milestone, risk identification, project planning, RUP, specifications, informal request, continuous integration, software outsourcing, offshore development, distributed programming,

text.p: When a [ROM Estimate]({% href process/cost/rom %}) is approved and the project is started, the project team has documentation that you provided to us - we call it an informal request (also called stakeholder request in RUP).

Your informal requests may include diagrams, specifications, spreadsheets, and other forms. All of this information is very important to the project team. This information shall be converted to [Specification]({% href process/scope/specification %}), as required by our process. This is the goal of the Inception Phase - to convert your informal requests into very detailed and well-structured Specifications.

ul.li: Refining the scope of the project

text.p: The Inception Phase is finished when Specification, [Schedule]({% href process/time/schedule %}), [Budget]({% href process/risk}">Risks, and <a href="${url:process/cost %}) are prepared and you reviewed them. Approval of these documents means a green light for the continuation of the project. The Inception Phase is finished with an [LCO Milestone]({% href process/time/lco %}).
10-15% of the ROM Estimate average (time and effort) is usually spent on the Inception Phase by the project manager and system analyst.

concepts.c1: The Schedule is a coarse-grained project plan developed by a project manager
concepts.c2: LCO Milestone approves the project Budget and Schedule
concepts.c3: Specification is the only document describing the entire scope of the project
